definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: The boy will bring you the keys at the door.
sentences.chinese: 茶房会在门口把钥匙交给你的。

sentences.english: Now the hall-boy pounded on the door and he released his hold upon her regretfully.
sentences.chinese: 这时旅馆的茶房把门敲得砰砰响，他遗憾地放开了她。

sentences.english: Carrie, flushed and excited, moved away as he admitted the boy.
sentences.chinese: 他让茶房进来时，嘉莉红着脸兴奋地走到一边。

sentences.english: The waiter seemed convinced that I could not deny it.
sentences.chinese: 看来那个茶房已经相信我否认不了了。

sentences.english: Carrie looked at the card handed by the boy and suffered a shock of surprise.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉看到茶房递给她的名片，大大地吃了一惊。

sentences.english: Having a full pantry can be fun and reassuring.
sentences.chinese: 茶房可以有充分的乐趣及安慰。

sentences.english: The porter stared at him the while he continued to talk.
sentences.chinese: 这个茶房瞪大眼睛看着他，这时他接着说。

sentences.english: I left my things in that tea house.
sentences.chinese: 我把东西留在了那家茶房。

definition: an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
a room in a Buddhist monastery/a temple
warm room/warm partition of a room
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
